The main form of organization of the educational process in the traditional education system is (Individual, frontal forms of education are traditional, and collective forms are fundamentally new in modern education. Recently, the interest of schoolchildren in learning has fallen sharply, which was to some extent facilitated by outdated forms of the lesson.)

The basis for the development of L.V. Zankov’ s didactic system was theoretical provisions (The education of a person who meets the modern requirements of society is possible only if, according to the famous statement of L.S. Vygotsky, education will run ahead of the child’ s development, that is, it will be carried out in the zone of immediate development, and not on the actual, already achieved the level. This basic psychological position for a modern school is interpreted by L.V.Zankov as the didactic principle of "learning at a high level of difficulty in compliance with the measure of difficulty." A prerequisite for its proper implementation is knowledge of the characteristics of the pupils, knowledge of the current level of their development. Constant study of the child, starting from his admission to school, allows us to accurately identify the maximum level of difficulty for each student of the proposed content and methods of its assimilation
The technology of developmental education by D.B. Elkonin – V.V. Davydov is aimed at

option1.content: development of ways of mental actions (The priority goal is the formation of ways of mental actions (COURT). The developing nature of learning in D.B.Elkonin - V.V.Davydov technology is primarily due to the fact that its content is based on theoretical knowledge

question.content: Who is the author of the system based on a personal-humanistic approach

option2.content: Sh.A. Amonashvili (Many years of teaching experience led Sh.A. Amonashvili to believe that there are two approaches to solving educational problems - imperative and humane. Education becomes imperative if it is built without taking into account the personal characteristics and needs of the child. The teacher who carries out such training is sure that the child will definitely resist him, and therefore he must be forced to study by strict requirements, imperatives. The humane approach consists in the fact that the educator thinks optimistically about children, approaches them as independent subjects of learning, capable of learning not under compulsion, but voluntarily, of their own volition and free choice. In other words, the teacher proceeds from the fact that each child has his own personal meaning, there is a personal significance of the teaching, on which it is necessary to rely in the pedagogical process. And if there is no such personal meaning, then it is necessary to help the child find it.
